Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is brown/black in section, interior caked with a thick brown resinous substance, exterior covered with a red/brown slip and faint traces of at least ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Curator's comments: The text is continued apparently on 1923,0327.17 (BM. 55750), whic was part of the same pot.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.87)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87589) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87589)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 90 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
